definition: Commonly recognized time periods or moments with established names

positive_examples: We usually have dinner at dinnertime around six o'clock
The sunrise this morning was absolutely beautiful
I prefer working during daytime hours when it's bright
The meeting is scheduled for 10 AM tomorrow
Let's meet for lunch at lunchtime
The sunset painted the sky orange and pink
negative_examples: The meeting will last for two hours
We waited there for a long time
The project deadline is next week
The concert starts in thirty minutes
This occurred during the Renaissance period
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Duration, Frequency, Deadline, TimeSequence
